 Maersk is undergoing a historic digital transformation, redefining how global trade connects through technology. As a
 **Lead Software Engineer (Operational Excellence)** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in driving engineering standards, enabling scalable product delivery, and ensuring seamless experiences for our customers, partners, and internal users worldwide.
   

  

 You will work across diverse technologies and teams, helping shape our next generation of platforms, tools, and practices that power Maersk’s digital ecosystem.
   

  

**Experience**
 14\\+ years in Software Engineering and Product Development with a focus on:
   

  

* Building large\\-scale, distributed systems
* Engineering excellence and operational reliability
* Technical mentorship and leadership


**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead discovery and design phases, translating business needs into scalable technical solutions.
* Define and uphold engineering standards and best practices in alignment with enterprise architecture guidelines.
* Design, build, and integrate complex information systems to meet business requirements.
* Ensure product architecture is optimized for scalability, performance, and maintainability.
* Collaborate across functions to deliver outcomes that advance business goals and customer experience.
* Champion modern engineering practices — CI/CD, automation, and cloud\\-native development — to accelerate product delivery.
* Partner with architects and stakeholders to define architecture roadmaps and drive key technology initiatives.
* Oversee implementation of SDLC methodologies and tools to support continuous improvement.
* Provide technical leadership across teams, fostering collaboration and innovation.
* Manage project budgets, forecast resource needs, and drive operational efficiency.


**What You’ll Do**
* Build the future tech stack that runs Maersk's Ecommerce Business
* Design and deliver integration solutions connecting diverse systems, applications, and data sources.
* Develop APIs, middleware, and integration frameworks ensuring security, scalability, and maintainability.
* Define and evolve integration architecture.
* Ensure best practices in Infrastructure Architecture, CI/CD, Deployment Automation, and Security.
* Collaborate with domain architects to ensure consistency and alignment across platforms.


**Who You Are**
* Worked in large tech environments that are scale driven. E\\-commerce tech experience is preferred, but not required
* Proven experience designing and delivering large\\-scale, high\\-performance integration solutions in hybrid (on\\-prem \\+ cloud) environments.
* Strong background in EDI management, API design, and microservices\\-based architectures.
* Hands\\-on experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions) and containerized workloads.
* Adept at translating business objectives into technical strategies and measurable outcomes.
* Excellent communication skills — able to simplify complex ideas for diverse audiences.
* Strong analytical mindset, problem\\-solving ability, and bias for action.
* Recognized as a technical thought leader with credibility across engineering and business teams.


**People Leadership**
* Inspire, mentor, and develop high\\-performing engineering teams.
* Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.
* Build and retain top talent through coaching, empowerment, and growth opportunities.
* Lead with humility and authenticity, creating an environment where people thrive.


**Additional Competencies**
* Curious and growth\\-oriented — continuously learning and improving.
* Action\\-driven — able to navigate ambiguity and deliver results in fast\\-paced environments.
* Strategic communicator — articulate complex information clearly across all levels.
* Business\\-aware technologist — understanding how technology drives value and operational excellence.


 Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

 TekWissen is a global workforce management provider throughout India and many other countries in the world. The below client is a global company with shared ideals and a deep sense of family. From our earliest days as a pioneer of modern transportation, we have sought to make the world a better place – one that benefits lives, communities and the planet
   

  

**Job Title: Software Engineer (I) \\- Established Engineer III**
**Location: Chennai**
**Work Type: Hybrid**
**Position Description**
* Employees in this job function are responsible for designing, developing, testing and maintaining software applications and products to meet customer needs.
* They are involved in the entire software development lifecycle including designing software architecture, writing code, testing for quality and deploying the software to meet customer requirements.
* Full\\-stack software engineering roles, who can develop all components of software including user interface and server side also fall within this job function.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Engage with customers to deeply understand their use\\-cases, pain points, and requirements, showcasing empathy and advocating for user\\-centric software solutions
* Solve complex problems by designing, developing, and delivering using various tools, languages, frameworks, methodologies (like agile) and technologies
* Assess the requirements of the software application or service and determine the most suitable technology stack, integration method, deployment strategy, etc.
* Create high\\-level software architecture designs that outline the overall structure, components, and interfaces of the application
* Collaborate with cross functional teams like product owners, designers, architects etc.
* Define and implement software test strategy, guidelines, policies and processes in line with organization vision, industry regulations and market best practices.
* Work on continuously improving performance and optimizing the application and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
* Familiar with programming practices, such as test\\-driven development, continuous integration, and continuous delivery
* Support security practices to safeguard user data including encryption and anonymization.
* Create user\\-friendly and interactive interfaces
* Develop and maintain back\\-end applications like APIs and microservices using server\\-side languages
* Evaluate and incorporate emerging technologies and capabilities to deliver their solutions, and are monitoring and participating in solutions for new stack layers, often involving industry collaboration


**Skills Required**
* Mainframe Systems


**Skills Preferred**
* IBM DB2, COBOL, IMS, JCL


**Experience Required**
* Engineer III Exp: Prac. In 2 coding lang. or adv. Prac. in 1 lang.
* 6\\+ years in IT;
* 4\\+ years in development and 2\\+ years in production support


**Experience Preferred**
* Strong technical skills in mainframe technologies (COBOL,JCL,DB2,IMS DB/DC) .
* IMS DB/DC is must. Experience in Endevor, SPUFI and File Manager.
* Resource should have hands\\-on and coding experience in mainframe technologies and should be able to provide break fix/development activity as well.
* Good understanding about the client's Architect Framework \\& Security and Controls.
* Good knowledge of Agile Central/Rally to report back the status.


**Education Required**
* Bachelor's Degree


**Education Preferred**
* Bachelor's Degree
